content.text: table is designed to store financial charge information related to tenants, likely within a governmental or organizational budgetary context. Each record in the table represents a unique charge entry associated with a tenant, identified by a sequence ID. The table includes fiscal year data, agency codes, budget group identifiers, charge percentages, and metadata about the user who authenticated the entry and timestamps for when the record was added or last updated.
The complexity of this table is considered medium due to the following factors:
It includes a mix of data types and default constraints.
It utilizes user-defined functions for default values, which adds a layer of abstraction.
The presence of multiple agency codes and budget group identifiers suggests potential relationships with other tables, though these are not explicitly defined here.

The table is likely used in a financial or budgetary system to track charges associated with tenants. Use cases may include:
Generating reports on tenant charges for a specific fiscal year.
Analyzing charge distribution across different agencies or budget groups.
Auditing and tracking changes made to tenant charge records, facilitated by the
